definitions.definition: Artificial echolocation by use of electronic equipment, with hydrophones to locate objects underwater , using the same wave -analysis principles that radar uses.
examples: They were able to detect the sunken wreck using sonar .

definitions.definition: A device that provides such echolocation.
examples: They finally bought a new sonar to replace the 40-year-old unit that sometimes didn't work right.
Submarines and bats both use sonar to navigate.

main_definition: ( nautical , usually uncountable ) Artificial echolocation by use of electronic equipment, with hydrophones to locate objects underwater , using the same wave -analysis principles that radar uses.
secondary_definitions: ( nautical , countable ) A device that provides such echolocation.
